heading: cdnow, columbia house to merge
subheading: the online retailer and the granddaddy of direct music marketing will combine and create a new e-commerce site. sony and time warner will also have a big piece of the venture. by joanna glasner.
author: joanna glasner
text: sony and time warner said tuesday that they have agreed to buy online music retailer cdnow and will jointly develop a new music site to combine the resources of two of the world's biggest record companies. the agreement would combine cdnow with columbia house, one of the largest music and video clubs. columbia house is jointly owned by time warner (twx) and sony (sne), which will each have a 37 percent stake in the new venture. cdnow (cdnw) will own 26 percent.read wired news' ongoing mp3 coverage
